pull.title: Add v0.16.3 backwards compatibility test, bump v0.19.0.1 to v0.19.1
pull.body:
Thanks to #18774's `adjust_bitcoin_conf_for_pre_17` we can now test backwards compatibility for v0.16.3, both for sync and loading a recent wallet.

This PR bumps v0.19.0.1 to v0.19.1.

I also made the version list consistent for the `contrib/devtools/previous_release.sh` instruction, between both tests.

author Sjors Provoost <sjors@sprovoost.nl> 1588591971 +0200
committer Sjors Provoost <sjors@sprovoost.nl> 1588592200 +0200

[test] add v0.16.3 backwards compatibility test

[test] backwards compatibility: bump v0.19.0.1 to v0.19.1

[ci] make list of previous releases to download a setting

Co-Authored-By: MarcoFalke <falke.marco@gmail.com>

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -37,6 +37,6 @@ if [ -z "$NO_DEPENDS" ]; then
 fi
 if [ "$TEST_PREVIOUS_RELEASES" = "true" ]; then
   BEGIN_FOLD previous-versions
-  DOCKER_EXEC contrib/devtools/previous_release.sh -b -t "$PREVIOUS_RELEASES_DIR" v0.15.2 v0.16.3 v0.17.1 v0.18.1 v0.19.0.1
+  DOCKER_EXEC contrib/devtools/previous_release.sh -b -t "$PREVIOUS_RELEASES_DIR" v0.15.2 v0.16.3 v0.17.1 v0.18.1 v0.19.1
comments.body:
```suggestion
  DOCKER_EXEC contrib/devtools/previous_release.sh -b -t "$PREVIOUS_RELEASES_DIR" "${PREVIOUS_RELEASES_TO_DOWNLOAD}"
```

Can this be made a setting in the ci/test/00_* config files instead of an inline configuration?

(just a nit)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -37,6 +37,6 @@ if [ -z "$NO_DEPENDS" ]; then
 fi
 if [ "$TEST_PREVIOUS_RELEASES" = "true" ]; then
   BEGIN_FOLD previous-versions
-  DOCKER_EXEC contrib/devtools/previous_release.sh -b -t "$PREVIOUS_RELEASES_DIR" v0.15.2 v0.16.3 v0.17.1 v0.18.1 v0.19.0.1
+  DOCKER_EXEC contrib/devtools/previous_release.sh -b -t "$PREVIOUS_RELEASES_DIR" v0.15.2 v0.16.3 v0.17.1 v0.18.1 v0.19.1
comments.body: Will push a commit with that once the current Travis run finishes.

```suggestion
if [ -n "$PREVIOUS_RELEASES_TO_DOWNLOAD" ]; then
```

nit in 9226c7236496ae92bfb472470c65b95caa95ed55, because `TEST_PREVIOUS_RELEASES` is primarily used to force the test of previous releases in the test framework (and fail if not available)
Oh, please only put this in the config that actually needs the releases
